Articles.Content:
Hello there,

Does anyone know of any mods that are compatible with 1.6.1 (yes I still use that, too lazy to find the updated versions of the 200000000000000 mods I have installed.) that add RANDOM FAILURES into the game? (capitalisation solely for dramatic effect)

I want to add some realism into the game so, yeah.

Also could anyone be so kind as to provide the link for Deadly Reentry's 1.6.x Release? The oldest I can get is 1.7.x

Thanks and I appreciate it.

Pretty much all the failure mods that i know of were around in 1.6, so your options are:

Dang It!

Oh Scrap!

Kerbal Launch Failure

BARIS (not sure if that one is 1.6)

Thank you for the mods, time to kill kerbals make the game more realistic.

Which one is the best or most realistic in your opinion

Thanks.

5 minutes ago, HyperDraco said:

Thank you for the mods, time to kill kerbals make the game more realistic.

Which one is the best or most realistic in your opinion

Thanks.

I mean, I'm the dev of Oh Scrap! so I'm biased - they all do different things depending on what you want, "realistic" is a subjective term in this case, none of them are hyper realistic, but they all represent a bit of realism in their own way. I'd look at each and make up your own mind.

11 hours ago, severedsolo said:

I mean, I'm the dev of Oh Scrap! so I'm biased - they all do different things depending on what you want, "realistic" is a subjective term in this case, none of them are hyper realistic, but they all represent a bit of realism in their own way. I'd look at each and make up your own mind.

Oh my, I was unknowingly blessed by the presence of the Dev of Oh Scrap! 

Ok then, all of them it is.

Thank you

PS: Thanks for the help, Oh Scrap! sounds pretty fun realistic.

3 hours ago, HyperDraco said:

Oh my, I was unknowingly blessed by the presence of the Dev of Oh Scrap! 

Ok then, all of them it is.

Thank you

PS: Thanks for the help, Oh Scrap! sounds pretty fun realistic.

Just one thing I feel I need to point out (and you probably already know this).

Old versions of mods = old bugs, not up to date features and you won't get support.

I'd recommend at least trying the latest 1.7.3 builds first to see if they work (mods built for 1.8 definitely won't work on 1.6, but you'll have a good chance with 1.7.3)

2 hours ago, severedsolo said:

Just one thing I feel I need to point out (and you probably already know this).

Old versions of mods = old bugs, not up to date features and you won't get support.

I'd recommend at least trying the latest 1.7.3 builds first to see if they work (mods built for 1.8 definitely won't work on 1.6, but you'll have a good chance with 1.7.3)

Thank you for the recommendation.

I will try to do that from now on.
